bibl.title: Despatch from Judson A. Lewis to John Hay, October 6, 1880
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.p:
No 32. U.S. Consulate at Sierra Leone
Judson A. Lewis To Dept. of State
Transmitting Quarterly Returns for Quarter Ending June 30th
No. 32. U.S. Consulate at Sierra Leone Oct 6th 1880.

Hon John Hay
Asst Secty of State
Washington D.C.
I have the honor to forward herewith to the Department the Returns for Quarter Ending June 30th which the Vice Consul neglected to forward during my absence on leave.

I am Sir Your
Obt Servant
Judson A. Lewis U.S. Consul

Names of all Deceased American Citizens, including Seamen or Mariners, together with the value of the personal effects belonging to them, and taken possession of by or deposited with M W Tobey U.S. Vice Consul at Sierra Leone, from April 1st to June 30th, inclusive.

row.cell: Of What Place a Native or Resident.
If a Seaman, to What Vessel Belonging.
Sent to Collector of Customs Oporto

div1.p: M W Tobey Vice U.S. Consul
